intro: Adinandra stenosepala, commonly known as the narrow-sepaled adinandra, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four to five sepals. It typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
